t: 9 Black Caiman Facts: Giant of Ecuador’s Amazon (Melanosuchus Niger) | Latin Roots Travel
s: There are lots of animals in the Amazon, but these guys are in a class all their own. Black caimans (melanosuchus niger) look similar to alligators and crocodiles. The family tree is quite intertwined, but according to recent research, the caiman is more similar to alligators than crocodiles.

s: May 17, 2024 - Growing up to 5 meters (16.4 feet), the black caiman is the largest member of the Alligatoridae family, which includes alligators, caimans, and their extinct relatives. The scales of black caiman are a dark green-tinged color that acts as camouflage in the murky waters of the Amazon at night.

s: March 10, 2025 - The black caiman is a large semi-aquatic crocodilian. It is the largest predator in the Amazon and the largest caiman in the world, with some individuals measuring 4 meters long, and weighing 300 kilograms. It gets its name for its dark skin which helps it camouflage when it hunts.
